content.name: Kevin Yeh
content.title: Front End / Full Stack Developer
content.info: Hello! I am a Front End / Full Stack Developer with a background in Graphic Design. My story began when I was a photo retoucher <career /> years ago and impulsively took a UC Berkeley Extension Coding Bootcamp. Since then, I utilize the best of both halves of my brain, bringing logic and creativity into my projects. From the small details to the large pictures, I make sure all aspects are thought of. My hope is to further that skill set and learn from as many people as I can. In this portfolio, I demonstrate the basic fundamentals of my current skill set.<b />Thank you for your time.

Started my interest in the art world by taking photography and digital media outside of school. I was not a fan high school.
content.title: San Mateo High School

content.info: Took Adobe Dreamweaver classes and self taught. Graduated with bachelors in Graphic Design and received Cum Laude honors.
content.title: Notre Dame de Namur University

content.info: Full stack course that was an extension of UC Berkeley. Presented with certificate for completion at the end of course.
content.title: UC Berkeley Bootcamp

content.info: Single-handedly led the front end team for <bold>2.5 years</bold> after 1 year starting as a web developer, applying best practices like BEM, SCSS, and SEO.
Architected JSON and full stack structures that allowed for quick and complex feature/product launches resulting in <bold>3-4 per month</bold>.
Developed <bold>new</bold> school, React style, web pages and animations while using <bold>old</bold> school technologies, including ES5 and jQuery.
With over <bold>1 million</bold> products, NodeJs scripts were created to edit hundreds of thousands of products at a time while utilizing Shopify's API.

Integrated with data services such as <bold>Google Optimize</bold> and <bold>Google Analytics</bold>, where key data was gathered to help decide on specific needs; as well as other API documentations.
Within one weekend, created a custom parallax scroll page template, using HTML, CSS, and Javascript, making it easy to <bold>plug and play</bold> which is still used to this day.
Shop clothing, accessories, protective wear and home decor designed by independent artists and manufactured responsibly. Every purchase helps communities in need.

VIDA is an online e-commerce platform that focuses on health and safety products to battle the ongoing rise of COVID-19. Such products include KN95 masks, N95 masks, KF94 masks, etc. I started as a web developer and quickly became one of the go to people for any front end project. Once COVID-19 hit, they kept only me for the front end position. Since then, I've managed the front end team for about 2 years.
With that in mind, I have learned a lot being on my own but feel that I needed more exposure in working with other developers and learning from senior developers.
Established core file structure fundamentals allowing for specific components to be reused as needed and scalability to not have a cap.
Included dynamic movement throughout the web page ranging from small animations to large whole page scrolls.
Calmly dealt with indecisive employer with constant changes and multiple iterations of design, where some were not even proper UI/UX.
One League is a global education institution connecting the world's highest potential change-makers to world-class education and opportunities to realize global impact.

One League was also started by the same owner as <wiki>VIDA</wiki>, where I was tasked to work on One League  projects as well. Working on One League led me to focus my area of expertise in more logic based Front End.
Developed features and templates with a quick turnaround time of less than a week while utilizing new process', such as Tailwind and GraphQL.
Refactored legacy code to ensure that it can handle the new process as well as scale and sustain the many years to come.

VIDA Health is the new and improved version of <wiki>VIDA</wiki>. VIDA Health includes products post COVID-19 which which range from masks to hand sanitizers. They utilize Shopify just like it's ancestor but simpler, keeping all data needed on the platform instead of multiple databases.
This was a small contracting project after ending my employment with VIDA to help develop certain aspects of the new site. There is no current link for this webpage as it is still being developed.
Set up, albeit simple, full stack dynamic React App allowing users to pick/build a design package that would be stored in a database and sent to an email.
Designed and developed static webpage illustrating and guiding users through the process of the app and The Graphic Jar's guidelines.

The Graphic Jar is a graphic design freelance that a college friend, Christina Sayegh, and I started in January 2017. We specialize in designs that involve branding a business, such as logos, business cards, and websites. Christina would handle all of the illustration aspects of the freelance where I would take care of any web design and development needed.

This portfolio is a full stack application where the JSON for data is stored in Firebase. It is called 'Wiki Pad' because it is styled in the form of a notepad with the capabilities of a wiki. A wiki is having internal links within the page that goes to another page of information. With the power of React, I was able to achieve this feature. This is the second iteration of my portfolio, the first one being 4 years prior, link below.

I had a lot of fun making this portfolio, as it as quite a bit of small features and animations that make this look simple yet full of little surprises. Hope you enjoy this as much as I had making it.
